Comments_List: Knowledge of Greek tragedy and the language of Attic drama, which I had never been exposed to before.

The close-reading went too slowly and often left us having to catch up in the subsequent class. Spending most every class doing the reading could become monotonous, so I think branching out into other sources or things like reception would add variety and interest. Overall, though, Professor Bakker's expertise really shone through, and we learned a tremendous amount.
Yes: it grants an important skill and is taught very well.
